page.title: 18FARMS AROUND FLAMSTEAD
page.content: In Flamstead the main farm lands are crops like wheat,oats,barley and corn.My Grandad owns a farm.It is called Woodend Farm.My dad lived there when he was little.It is mostly crops. They have bullocks,sheep,chickens, ducks and geese.In the olden days cows were milked by hand and stool and bucket.Now they are milked by machine. The milk is stored in a churn.Jersey cows give the creamiest milk.Sheep give you meat and wool.Probably the busiest time is Harvest.The farmers go backwards and forwards in tractors or on the combine which is very dusty. They burn the stubble and put dirt around the edge of the field so the fire doesn't spread.Obviously machinery is now very important to our farmers.
